title: Britaines honour In the two valiant Welchmen, who fought against fifteene thousand Scots, at their now comming to England passing over Tyne; wherof one was kill'd manfully fighting against his foe, and the other being taken prisoner, is now (upon relaxation) come to Yorke to his Majestie. The tune is, How now Mars, &c.
author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?
publisher: Printed by E. G[riffin] and are to be sold [by T. Lambert] at the Horse-Shooe in Smith-field,
